getWorkDatesBetween
This is implemented by calling the
new
constructor, which creates an instance of the LocalDate class.
by calendar;
for a specified employee;
for a specified System user.
Syntax
getWorkDatesBetween (period, calendar | employee | user, startDate, endDate)
Setting
Purpose
period
The period type, for which the calculation of working time will be carried out. Selected when calling the function in the modal window " Calculate working hours by calendar". Possible values:
• day;
• hour;
• minute;
• second.
calendar/employee/user
An instance of one of the following types (or a child type) can be specified as a parameter:
1. "Calendar." [SYS_CALENDAR], by which the working days should be calculated.
2. "Employee" [SYS_EMPLOYEE], by which the information about the working days/hours of the employee is determined. The calculation is made using the production (or general) calendar of the employee.
3. "User". [SYS_USER]. The System uses the employee’s production (or general) calendar for the calculation from the specified user.
The current employee is set by default when the function is called - currentUser(Employee).
startDate
Deductible date ("Date" or "Date and time" type attribute).
The current date is set by default when the function is called - currentDate().
endDate
Decrementable date ("Date" or "Date and time" type attribute).
The current date is set by default - currentDate()
Note
The function is called using the
button, located in the Algorithm Editor on the "Date" tab.
This will open a modal window where the type of dynamics to calculate the working hours according to the calendar should be selected.
After selecting and clicking the "OK" button, the function construction with the selected dynamics type and with the default values of the other parameters, that should be replaced within the task, will be added to the algorithm code.
Example
To calculate the standard deadline for completing the tasks, depending on the time of its receipt to the specialist, taking into account the local working hours of the responsible employee, use an algorithm (fragment):
Refer to
Process Stage Widget
to learn an example of how to use the getWorkDatesBetween function.
